greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the quadratic nonresidues of prime(n).
comment: For all n > 2, prime(n) divides a(n).
reference: D. M. Burton, Elementary Number Theory, McGraw-Hill, Sixth Edition (2007), p. 185.
link: N. Hobson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Aebi, Christian, and Grant Cairns. Sums of Quadratic residues and nonresidues, arXiv preprint arXiv:1512.00896 (2015).
N. Hobson, Home page (listed in lieu of email address)
formula: If prime(n) = 4k+1 then a(n) = k(4k+1) = A076409(n).
example: The quadratic nonresidues of 7=prime(4) are 3, 5 and 6. Hence a(4) = 3+5+6 = 14.
program: (PARI) vector(47, n, p=prime(n); t=1; for(i=2, (p-1)/2, t+=((i^2)%p)); p*(p-1)/2-t)
xref: Sums of residues, nonresidues, and their differences, for p == 1 (mod 4), p == 3 (mod 4), and all p: A171555; A282035, A282036, A282037; A076409, A125615, A282038.
results.author: Nick Hobson, Nov 30 2006
